title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: First FDA-cleared Alzheimer's blood test could make diagnoses faster, more accurate
items.description: The first Alzheimer's blood test cleared by the Food And Drug Administration is poised to change the way doctors diagnose and treat the disease.

items.title: 'Which is it?' RFK Jr. waffles on cuts to lead poisoning prevention efforts
items.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced tough questions from senators about a lead poisoning crisis in public schools in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

items.title: Former Kennedy Center president refutes Trump's critique of 'bad management'
items.description: "I am deeply troubled by the false allegations regarding the management of the Kennedy Center," Deborah Rutter wrote in a statement.

items.title: The pros and cons of PSA tests for prostate cancer for midlife and older men
items.description: With Biden's prostate cancer in the news, men may be wondering whether and at what age to be screened. Advice about the value PSA tests has fluctuated...

items.title: A Jan 6 rioter convicted of assaulting police scored a visit to the White House
items.description: Two pardoned Jan. 6 rioters posted photos and videos of themselves visiting the White House. One of them was convicted of assaulting police and texted...

items.title: Democratic Rep. McIver is due for first court appearance on assault charges
What is the Golden Dome? Here's what to know about Trump's plan.
items.description: President Trump's missile defense project, called the "Golden Dome for America," could cost hundreds of billions of dollars.

items.title: What is AI Mode, Google's new artificial intelligence search tech?
items.description: Google is making more upgrades to its search engine with the addition of the AI Mode feature.

items.title: 'The mood is changing': Israeli anger grows at conduct of war
items.description: Support for the war in Gaza is waning, with some Israeli political and military figures criticising the conflict in recent days.

items.title: Anti-Hamas protests in southern Gaza enter third day
items.description: Protesters were seen in videos calling for an end to the war and the removal of the armed group from Gaza

items.title: Stock market falls sharply after Target reports sales drop
items.description: Stocks tumbled Wednesday amid signs that tariffs are weighing on consumer spending and investor concerns about the U.S. fiscal outlook.

items.title: Watch moment Trump ambushes Ramaphosa with video
items.description: In an extraordinary Oval Office meeting, Trump pressed Cyril Ramaphosa on widely discredited claims of a white genocide in South Africa.

items.title: DOJ ending probes of Minneapolis and Louisville police departments
items.description: The Justice Department said it will bring an end to investigations launched during the Biden administration after the deaths of George Floyd in Minnea...

items.title: Trump confronts South African president with claim of Afrikaners being 'persecuted'
items.description: Cyril Ramaphosa responds that black people are likelier to be victims of violence in South Africa than white people.

items.title: Most AAPI adults oppose college funding cuts and student deportations, a new poll finds

items.description: Ten inmates escaped from a New Orleans jail late last week.

items.title: US accepts gifted Qatari plane to join Air Force One fleet
items.description: The White House insists that the gift is legal, but some of Trump's biggest backers have criticised the deal.
